questions.question: Which of the following best     describes a “prejudice”?

choices.answer: Preconceived idea about people applied to an individual
When people act on a prejudice and treat others unfairly
Labels based on generalization generally applied to individ
All of the above

questions.question: Which of the following is     NOT one of the four different types of workplace discrimination?

choices.answer: Union      Limitations/Restrictions
Undue      Hardship
Poisoned      Environment
Accommodation

questions.question: A “right” is

choices.answer: Something you are entitled to expect from thegovernment
Something all people, worldwide, guaranteed by theirgov
Something you are entitled to
All of the above

questions.question: A “freedom” is:

choices.answer: Something      you are entitled to expect from the gov.
Somethingpeople, worldwide,are guaranteed by their gov.
Something you are entitled to
All of the above

questions.question: Using the authority under Section 52 of the Constitution Act is only applicable a law is seen

choices.answer: as being inconsistent with the morals & values ofsociety
as being irrelevant
as      being inconsistent with the Canadian Constitution.
as being unfair or discriminatory.

questions.question: If a remedy is sought under Section 52 of the Constitution act, what might result

choices.answer: The law will be struck down and declaredunconstitutional
The      law will be read down and invalid parts removed.
The      law will be read in and modified.
All of the above

questions.question: What is the role of the     Human Rights Commission in Ontario?

choices.answer: Encourage public education on human rights &discrimination
To      deal with human rights complaints.
To promote human rights in Ontario
All of the above

questions.question: What are mobility rights?

choices.answer: Everyone is equal before the law;no discrimination.
The right to vote.
Guarantees that you can move freely inside and outsideof Can
The right to own a sweet ride

questions.question: Reasonable Limits Clause is.........

choices.answer: Is a term used in the game of horseshoes
Your rights and freedoms are subject to limits
You have the right to defend yourself if it's reasonable
GOV can enact legislation that violates ourrights/freedoms.

questions.question: What is the correct order?

choices.answer: Stereotype leads to Discrimination leads to Prejuduce
Prejudice leads to Stereotypes leads to Discrimination
Stereotypes leads to Prejudice leads to Discrimination
Kind of a chicken and egg question, AIN'T IT!

questions.question: What is unintentional discrimination?

choices.answer: Treating someone unfairly, unaware that it's discriminatory
Setting standards for a job that limit the success of some
Knowingly committing a discriminatory act
All of the above

questions.question: The process of filing a human rights complaint in Ontario is best described as follows

choices.answer: The Order of Action doesn't matter, only justice matters
File a Human Rights Complaint, remedy, Human Rights Tribunal
File a complaint, go to the Human Rights Tribunal, remedy
Human Rights Tribunal, file a human rights complaint,remedy

questions.question: Using the authority of Section 24 of the Charter is only applicable when...........

choices.answer: someone’sequality rights have been infringed upon or denied
someone’slegal rights have been infringed upon or denied.
someone’sdemocratic rights have been infringed upon / denied
Noneof the above.

questions.question: Which of the following does NOT     describe the Supreme Court of Canada?

choices.answer: It is the highest court      of Canada.
Itis responsible for interpreting and enforcing the Charter
It is where all major      criminal cases are heard.
Itis the final court of appeal in the Can Justice System.

questions.question: The reasonable limits clause is found in section _____

choices.answer: his right to be presumed innocent until proven guilty.
hisright to habeas corpus.
hisright to liberty.

choices.answer: 6 months
1 year
2 years
